Posts.Content: My husband was diagnosed 3 years ago- Stage 4 metastatic PC. Started immediately on docataxel with hormon shots monthly, have already done radiation, provenge, and Xtandi- new scans show enormous amounts of new mestasis on spine , ribs, legs, and feet . Started second cycle of chemo. I feel like the doctor is being vague- my gut is telling me this is not good and time is running out. Anyone else have a rapid aggressive growing form of PC? There are so many articles out there, one says hes going to die within months while others seem to give the illusion of lasting years. Thoughts? Experiences??
Posts.Title: Is it time to worry?

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone! We asked the doctor about clinical trials and he said there arent any right now that he would be eligible for... so chemo it is for now. Second round on 3/28, scans again in June to see if its even working to help slow it down.
Posts.Title: Is it time to worry?
